thread.title: Northumberland MP pleads for David Cameron to stay in Downing Street regardless of EU result
thread.title_full: Northumberland MP pleads for David Cameron to stay in Downing Street regardless of EU result

author: Will Metcalfe
title: Northumberland MP pleads for David Cameron to stay in Downing Street regardless of EU result
text:
Northumberland MP pleads for David Cameron to stay in Downing Street regardless of EU result 23:08, 23 Jun 2016 Anne-Marie Trevelyan, who represents Berwick, was one of 84 MPs to urge for the Prime Minister to remain in place regardless of the referendum result Shares Get daily news by email Geoff Caddick/PA Wire Prime Minister David Cameron 
A Northumberland MP has urged David Cameron to remain in Downing Street regardless of the EU referendum result. 
Anne-Marie Trevelyan, MP for Berwick , was among 84 MPs to sign the letter which was delivered to Downing Street on Thursday. 
Mrs Trevelyan, who backed the Brexit campaign, was one of the North East’s firmest critics of remaining in the European Union 
The letter said: “Dear Prime Minister, we, who are supporters of Vote Leave and members of the Conservative Parliamentary Party, thank you for giving the British people a choice of their destiny on June 23 2016. 
“We believe whatever the British people decide, you have both a mandate and a duty to continue leading the nation implementing our 2015 manifesto.” 
Other signatories included Michael Gove, Boris Johnson, and Crispin Blunt. 
Voter turnout is expected to be at its highest since 1992 and two independent polls have placed the Remain campaign emerging victorious by 52% and 54%. Conservative MP for Berwick Anne-Marie Trevelyan 
Education secretary Nicky Morgan said if there is a Remain victory the Government will go on seeking reform in the EU. 
“I think if there’s been a clear win then that’s sending a message,” Mrs Morgan said. 
“One of the things obviously is going to be implementing the reform deal the Prime Minister secured back in February.” More on the EU Referendum
